department.dept_long_name: Division of Engineering and Applied Sciences

course.title: Environmental Science and Technology
course.faculty_text: Scot T. Martin and Patrick D. Ulrich
course.description: An introduction to the role of technology in the environmental sciences, with foci on energy and water topics. The basic scientific principles underlying human use and control of the environment are emphasized. The course includes several field trips.
course.prerequisites: The course presumes basic knowledge in chemistry, physics, and mathematics at the high school level.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Science of the Physical Universe.
